text.4_Deuteronomy, 9_Chapter, 5_Verse, 0_Com: The Children of Israel journeyed from Beeroth-bene-jaakan, meaning do not say Aaron died at the Golden Calf affair at the beginning of the forty years and my[Moses] prayer didn't help him, because ultimately [as the pasuk shows us] Aaron died at the end of the forty years at Mount Hor at the same time as The Children of Israel journeyed from Beeroth-bene-jaakan after arriving there from Moserah.
text.1_Exodus, 2_Chapter, 2_Verse, 0_Comment: In that place grassy land for grazing is found
text.3_Numbers, 19_Chapter, 1_Verse, 0_Commen: And they joined against Moses and Aharon - they were not punished now as they were in the other complaints, because now they have a case. There really is no water (after Miriam's death).
text.0_Genesis, 23_Chapter, 26_Verse, 0_Comme: The word “baruch,” when used in relation to the Holy One of Blessing, whether in Torah text, or Mishnah, or Prayer or Mitzvah or fruits is an expression of greeting, like SHLOMIR in French, or of praise.
text.0_Genesis, 1_Chapter, 8_Verse, 1_Comment: "and the tree of knowledge of good and bad:" as its (Onkelos) translation (explains) - the tree which the one who eats it(s fruit) knows good and bad.
